full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN Document 765 Filed 08/10/22 Page 9 of 95 2747 LCI1MAX1

1 sexual activity as charged in the indictment, which is a
2 reference to the violation of New York law, because that is the
3 theory we're proceeding under.
4
5 With respect to Carolyn, there was no limiting
6 instruction, but it's evident we were talking about Florida
7 conduct. There is no violation of New York law there. So the
8 only evidence we have that goes to -- that actually establishes
9 a violation of New York law, which is the object of this
10 conspiracy, and the object of the transportation conspiracy, is
11 what Jane said.
12 Now the Court did instruct the jury that they can
13 consider the testimony of Kate and of Annie for whatever
14 relevant purpose they see fit, and I suppose that could be
15 evidence of a conspiracy, correct, but for them to actually
16 convict on this, they have to believe that somebody committed a
17 violation of New York law, and that relates solely to Jane, and
18 so we don't think -- there are no multiple alleged victims of
19 this conspiracy other than Jane that's been established by the
20 evidence at trial. So we believe while they may be able to
21 consider the testimony of Annie and Kate as evidence of some
22 sort of relevant evidence that speaks to this conspiracy, that
23 is not -- they are not victims of this conspiracy, there was no
24 violation of New York law that they testified to, and that is
25 Jane alone. So this count relates solely to Jane, as does the
26 substantive count, your Honor.

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300

DOJ-OGR-00016935
